DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: Single-cell Ribonucleic Acid Sequencing (scRNA-Seq)
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: sc_rnaseq
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: For single cell RNA-seq studies with a focus on the essential contextual details for the sampling and sequencing of genomic data.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: study
FIELD_GROUP.LABEL: Study

FIELD.LABEL: Study ID
FIELD.NAME: study_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study

FIELD.LABEL: Project Name
FIELD.NAME: project_name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Official name of the study or project. Project title should be fewer than 30 words, such as a title of a grant proposal or a publication.
FIELD.EXAMPLE: Study of single cells in the human body

FIELD.LABEL: Description
FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A detailed description of the project which includes research goals and experimental approach. Project description should be fewer than 300 words, such as an abstract from a grant application or publication.
FIELD.EXAMPLE: This project explores the intricate details of single cells in the human body, focusing on their structure, function, and behaviour. By studying individual cells, it aims to uncover how they contribute to overall health, disease progression, and human biology. This research can provide deeper insights into cellular processes, paving the way for advancements in medical treatments and personalised medicine.

FIELD.LABEL: Workflow
FIELD.NAME: workflow
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The workflow or protocol followed during the study.

FIELD.LABEL: Technology
FIELD.NAME: technology
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The sorting or visualisation technology used.

FIELD.LABEL: Negative Control Type
FIELD.NAME: neg_cont_type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation

FIELD.LABEL: Positive Control Type
FIELD.NAME: pos_cont_type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive

FIELD.LABEL: Experimental Factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental_factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Variable aspects of an experiment design that can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI)

FIELD.LABEL: Relevant Electronic Resources
FIELD.NAME: associated_resource
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: person
FIELD_GROUP.LABEL: Person

FIELD.LABEL: Study ID
FIELD.NAME: study_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study

FIELD.LABEL: Orcid ID
FIELD.NAME: orcid_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A 16-digit number that uniquely identify researchers.

FIELD.LABEL: First Name
FIELD.NAME: givenName
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A first name (or given name) is the personal name given to an individual conducting the study.

FIELD.LABEL: Last Name
FIELD.NAME: familyName
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A last name (or surname) is the family name passed down from one generation to the next for the individual conducting the study.

FIELD.LABEL: Email Address
FIELD.NAME: email
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier used to send and receive electronic messages (emails) over the internet.

FIELD.LABEL: Affiliation or Institution
FIELD.NAME: affiliation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An organisation or institution that this person is associated with.

FIELD.LABEL: Funder
FIELD.NAME: funder
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

FIELD.LABEL: Grant Award
FIELD.NAME: funding
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A grant that directly or indirectly provides funding or sponsorship for the person to conduct the study.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample
FIELD_GROUP.LABEL: Sample

FIELD.LABEL: Study ID
FIELD.NAME: study_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for the study if refering to

FIELD.LABEL: Sample ID
FIELD.NAME: sample_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the study.

FIELD.LABEL: Specific Host
FIELD.NAME: specific_host
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the host's taxonomic name and/or NCBI taxonomy ID

FIELD.LABEL: Organism
FIELD.NAME: organism
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The full scientific name of the species studied.

FIELD.LABEL: Microbial Starter NCBI Taxonomy ID
FIELD.NAME: microb_start_taxID
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An identifier of the strain of the organism, if applicable.

FIELD.LABEL: Tissue
FIELD.NAME: tissue
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of tissue sampled for the study.

FIELD.LABEL: Collection Date
FIELD.NAME: collection_date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008; Except: 2008-01; 2008 all are ISO8601 compliant

FIELD.LABEL: Geographic Location (Latitude and Longitude)
FIELD.NAME: lat_lon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees, limited to 8 decimal points, and in WGS84 system

FIELD.LABEL: Broad-scale Environmental Context
FIELD.NAME: env_broad_scale
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). Reference: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: Local Environmental Context
FIELD.NAME: env_local_scale
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling.

FIELD.LABEL: Environmental Medium
FIELD.NAME: env_medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling.

FIELD.LABEL: Accession Number
FIELD.NAME: accession_number
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier assigned to the sample in the study related to NCBI Taxonomy.

FIELD.LABEL: Geographic Location (Country and/or Sea, Region)
FIELD.NAME: geo_loc_name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ)

FIELD.LABEL: Depth
FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The vertical distance below local surface. For sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples

FIELD.LABEL: Elevation
FIELD.NAME: elev
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Elevation of the sampling site is its height above a fixed reference point, most commonly the mean sea level. Elevation is mainly used when referring to points on the earth's surface, while altitude is used for points above the surface, such as an aircraft in flight or a spacecraft in orbit

FIELD.LABEL: Amount or Size of Sample Collected
FIELD.NAME: samp_size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected

FIELD.LABEL: Library Screening Strategy
FIELD.NAME: lib_screen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating libraries

FIELD.LABEL: Reference Database(s)
FIELD.NAME: ref_db
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of database(s) used for ORF annotation, along with version number and reference to website or publication

FIELD.LABEL: Temperature
FIELD.NAME: temp
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling in degree celsius

FIELD.LABEL: Isolation and Growth Condition
FIELD.NAME: isol_growth_condt
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material

FIELD.LABEL: Altitude
FIELD.NAME: alt
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Heights of objects such as airplanes, space shuttles, rockets, atmospheric balloons and heights of places such as atmospheric layers and clouds in metres (m). It is used to measure the height of an object which is above the earth's surface. In this context, the altitude measurement is the vertical distance between the earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air

FIELD.LABEL: Source Material ID
FIELD.NAME: source_mat_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field.

FIELD.LABEL: Ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly)

FIELD.LABEL: Known Pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic

FIELD.LABEL: Propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of reproduction from the parent stock. Values for this field is specific to different taxa.

FIELD.LABEL: Sample Collection Device
FIELD.NAME: samp_collect_device
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The device used to collect an environmental sample.

FIELD.LABEL: Observed Biotic Relationship
FIELD.NAME: biotic_relationship
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of relationship(s) between the subject organism and other organism(s) it is associated with.

FIELD.LABEL: Reference for Biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: ref_biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report

FIELD.LABEL: Taxonomic Identity Marker
FIELD.NAME: tax_ident
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The phylogenetic marker(s) used to assign an organism name to the SAG or MAG

FIELD.LABEL: Trophic Level
FIELD.NAME: trophic_level
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

FIELD.LABEL: Subspecific Genetic Lineage
FIELD.NAME: subspecf_gen_lin
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information about the genetic distinctness of the sequenced organism below the subspecies level, e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123

FIELD.LABEL: Host Disease Status
FIELD.NAME: host_disease_stat
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from the DO (Human Disease Ontology) at https://www.disease-ontology.org, non-human host diseases are free text

FIELD.LABEL: Sample Collection Method
FIELD.NAME: samp_collect_method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method employed for collecting the sample

FIELD.LABEL: Taxonomy ID of DNA Sample
FIELD.NAME: samp_taxon_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: NCBI taxon id of the sample. Maybe be a single taxon or mixed taxa sample. Use 'synthetic metagenome for mock community/positive controls, or 'blank sample' for negative controls

FIELD.LABEL: Taxonomic Classification
FIELD.NAME: tax_class
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used for taxonomic classification, along with reference database used, classification rank, and thresholds used to classify new genomes

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: dissociation
FIELD_GROUP.LABEL: Dissociation

FIELD.LABEL: Study ID
FIELD.NAME: study_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study

FIELD.LABEL: Dissociation Protocol ID
FIELD.NAME: dissociation_protocol_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric code for the dissociation protocol in the study

FIELD.LABEL: Protocol Name
FIELD.NAME: protocol_name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A descriptive name of the protocol used for single-cell sequencing.

FIELD.LABEL: Dissociation Description
FIELD.NAME: dissociation_description
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A free-text description of the process used to separate cells from tissues or cell aggregates.
FIELD.EXAMPLE: Tissue was enzymatically dissociated using collagenase for 30 minutes.

FIELD.LABEL: Enrichment Markers
FIELD.NAME: enrichment_markers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the specificity markers used to isolate cell populations, e.g. 'CD45+'. Please contact FAANG DCC to add more terms.

FIELD.LABEL: Isolation Kit
FIELD.NAME: isolation_kit
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The kit used to isolate the cells.

FIELD.LABEL: Literature Source Reference
FIELD.NAME: literature_source_reference
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to literature sources that describe the protocol or methods used.
FIELD.EXAMPLE: Doe et al. (2024), 'Single-cell RNA-seq: A comprehensive overview'

FIELD.LABEL: Protocols Io Reference
FIELD.NAME: protocols_io_reference
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference link to protocols.io for additional details on the protocol.

FIELD.LABEL: Workflowhub Sop Reference
FIELD.NAME: workflow_hub_sop_reference
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference to the Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) in workflow hub.

FIELD.LABEL: Dissociation Protocol Method
FIELD.NAME: dissociation_protocol_method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method used to dissociate tissues into single cells.

FIELD.LABEL: p
FIELD.NAME: single_cell_quality_metric
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Metrics used to assess the quality of single cells before sequencing.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: cell_suspension
FIELD_GROUP.LABEL: Cell Suspension

FIELD.LABEL: Study ID
FIELD.NAME: study_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study

FIELD.LABEL: Sample ID
FIELD.NAME: sample_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier assigned to the cell suspension for the sample in the study.

FIELD.LABEL: Dissociation Protocol ID
FIELD.NAME: dissociation_protocol_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric code for the dissociation protocol in the study

FIELD.LABEL: Cell Suspension ID
FIELD.NAME: cell_suspension_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric code for the cell suspension for the sample

FIELD.LABEL: Suspension Type
FIELD.NAME: suspension_type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of suspension used to keep cells in solution during processing.

FIELD.LABEL: Cell Count
FIELD.NAME: cell_count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: An number representing the number of cells in the sequencing library.

FIELD.LABEL: Cell Viability
FIELD.NAME: cell_viability
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The percentage of living cells in a sample, indicating the health and quality of cells for RNA-sequencing analysis.

FIELD.LABEL: Cell Viability Assessment Method
FIELD.NAME: cell_viability_assessment_method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method used to evaluate the viability of cells in the sample, often involving staining or flow cytometry techniques.

FIELD.LABEL: Cell Size
FIELD.NAME: cell_size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The size of the cell, typically measured in micrometres.

FIELD.LABEL: Suspension Volume (L)
FIELD.NAME: suspension_volume_l
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The volume of the cell suspension in microlitres (L).

FIELD.LABEL: Suspension Concentration Cells Per L
FIELD.NAME: suspension_concentration_cells_per_l
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The concentration of cells in the suspension in microlitres (L).

FIELD.LABEL: Suspension Dilution
FIELD.NAME: suspension_dilution
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The dilution factor of the cell suspension.

FIELD.LABEL: Loading Volume l
FIELD.NAME: loading_volume_l
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The volume of the cell suspension loaded into the single-cell RNA-sequencing system for analysis.

FIELD.LABEL: Suspension Dilution Buffer
FIELD.NAME: suspension_dilution_buffer
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A solution used to dilute cell suspensions to a desired concentration, typically prior to loading cells into a device for single-cell RNA sequencing. It helps maintain cell viability and integrity during processing.
FIELD.EXAMPLE: PBS (Phosphate-buffered saline) with 0.04% BSA (Bovine serum albumin)

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: lib_prep
FIELD_GROUP.LABEL: Library Preparation

FIELD.LABEL: Study ID
FIELD.NAME: study_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study

FIELD.LABEL: Library Preparation ID
FIELD.NAME: library_prep_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.

FIELD.LABEL: Cell Suspension ID
FIELD.NAME: cell_suspension_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric code for the cell suspension for the library preparation.

FIELD.LABEL: Library Preparation Kit
FIELD.NAME: library_prep_kit
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Packaged kits (containing adapters, indexes, enzymes, buffers etc.), tailored for specific sequencing workflows, which allow the simplified preparation of sequencing-ready libraries for small genomes, amplicons, and plasmids

FIELD.LABEL: Library Preparation Kit Version
FIELD.NAME: library_prep_kit_version
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The version number of the library preparation kit used for sequencing.

FIELD.LABEL: Amplification Method
FIELD.NAME: amplification_method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method used to amplify the Complementary DNA (cDNA).

FIELD.LABEL: cDNA Amplification Cycles
FIELD.NAME: cdna_amplification_cycles
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The number of cycles used during the Complementary DNA (cDNA) amplification process.

FIELD.LABEL: Average Size Distribution
FIELD.NAME: average_size_distribution
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The average length of RNA fragments in base pairs (BP) after library preparation, indicating the quality and suitability of the RNA for sequencing.

FIELD.LABEL: Library Construction Method
FIELD.NAME: lib_construction_method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The library construction method (including version) that was used.

FIELD.LABEL: Input Molecule
FIELD.NAME: input_molecule
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The specific fraction of biological macromolecule from which the sequencing library is derived.

FIELD.LABEL: Primer
FIELD.NAME: primer
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of primer used for reverse transcription. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input for mRNA.

FIELD.LABEL: Primeness
FIELD.NAME: primeness
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The end from which the molecule was sequenced.

FIELD.LABEL: End Bias
FIELD.NAME: end_bias
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The end bias of the library.

FIELD.LABEL: Library Strand
FIELD.NAME: library_strand
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The Complementary DNA (cDNA) strand of the library from which the reads derived from - sense (first), antisense (second), both or none.

FIELD.LABEL: Spike In
FIELD.NAME: spike_in
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: External RNA added to the sample as a control to assess technical variability and normalization in RNA-sequencing. State whether spike-in was used.

FIELD.LABEL: Spike Type
FIELD.NAME: spike_type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The specific type of external RNA used for spiking in, often indicating the source or nature of the control RNA.

FIELD.LABEL: Spike In Dilution Or Concentration
FIELD.NAME: spike_in_dilution_or_concentration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The final concentration or dilution (for commercial sets) of the spike in mix.

FIELD.LABEL: i5 Index
FIELD.NAME: i5_index
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Barcode sequence used on the i5 adapter during library preparation for identifying samples in multiplexed single-cell RNA-sequencing.

FIELD.LABEL: i7 Index
FIELD.NAME: i7_index
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Barcode sequence used on the i7 adapter to distinguish samples in multiplexed sequencing runs.

FIELD.LABEL: Dual or Single Index
FIELD.NAME: dual_single_index
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specifies if both i5 and i7 indices (dual) or only one index (single) was used for sample identification during sequencing.

FIELD.LABEL: I5 Sequence
FIELD.NAME: i5_sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The nucleotide sequence of the i5 index used in multiplexing during sequencing.

FIELD.LABEL: i7 Sequence
FIELD.NAME: i7_sequence
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The specific nucleotide sequence of the i7 index used for a sample.

FIELD.LABEL: Plate ID
FIELD.NAME: plate_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Identifier for the 96-well plate used in sample preparation.

FIELD.LABEL: Well Row
FIELD.NAME: well_row
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The row identifier in a 96-well plate indicating the sample's position.

FIELD.LABEL: Well Column
FIELD.NAME: well_col
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The column identifier in a 96-well plate indicating the sample's position.

FIELD.LABEL: Cell Phenotype
FIELD.NAME: cell_phenotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The cell marker for the Fluorescence-Activated Cell Sorting (FACS) of cells.

FIELD.LABEL: Nucleic Acid Amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucl_acid_amp
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids. The link can be a PMID, DOI or URL.

FIELD.LABEL: Nucleic Acid Extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucl_acid_ext
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

FIELD.LABEL: Amount or Size of Sample Collected
FIELD.NAME: samp_size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected

FIELD.LABEL: Estimated Size
FIELD.NAME: estimated_size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The estimated size of the genome prior to sequencing in base pairs (bp). Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period

FIELD.LABEL: Sample Volume or Weight for DNA Extraction
FIELD.NAME: samp_vol_we_dna_ext
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction.

FIELD.LABEL: Library Vector
FIELD.NAME: lib_vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: Adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: Sample Material Processing
FIELD.NAME: samp_mat_process
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed
FIELD.EXAMPLE: filtering of seawater, storing samples in ethanol

FIELD.LABEL: Design description
FIELD.NAME: design_description
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The design of the library including details of how it was constructed.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sequencing
FIELD_GROUP.LABEL: Sequencing

FIELD.LABEL: Study ID
FIELD.NAME: study_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study

FIELD.LABEL: Sequencing ID
FIELD.NAME: sequencing_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.

FIELD.LABEL: Sequencing Platform Name
FIELD.NAME: sequencing_platform_name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the sequencing platform used for the experiment.

FIELD.LABEL: Sequencing Instrument Model
FIELD.NAME: sequencing_instrument_model
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: This refers to the machine or platform used for sequencing, with variations in throughput, read lengths, error rates, and application suitability.

FIELD.LABEL: Library Layout
FIELD.NAME: lib_layout
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specify whether to expect single, paired, or other configuration of reads for sequencing

FIELD.LABEL: UMI Barcode Read
FIELD.NAME: umi_barcode_read
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of read that contains the Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) barcode.

FIELD.LABEL: UMI Barcode Offset
FIELD.NAME: umi_barcode_offset
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The offset in sequence of the Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) identifying barcode.

FIELD.LABEL: UMI Barcode Size
FIELD.NAME: umi_barcode_size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The size of the Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) identifying barcode.

FIELD.LABEL: Cell Barcode Read
FIELD.NAME: cell_barcode_read
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of read that contains the UMI barcode.

FIELD.LABEL: Cell Barcode Offset
FIELD.NAME: cell_barcode_offset
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode.

FIELD.LABEL: Cell Barcode Size
FIELD.NAME: cell_barcode_size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The offset in sequence of the cell identifying barcode.

FIELD.LABEL: cDNA Read
FIELD.NAME: cdna_read
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The actual nucleotide sequence obtained from Complementary DNA (cDNA) during sequencing.

FIELD.LABEL: cDNA Read Offset
FIELD.NAME: cdna_read_offset
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The starting position of the Complementary DNA (cDNA) read within the entire sequence, indicating where the read begins after any barcodes or technical sequences.

FIELD.LABEL: cDNA Read Size
FIELD.NAME: cdna_read_size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The size of the Complementary DNA (cDNA) read.

FIELD.LABEL: Library Size
FIELD.NAME: lib_size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: Completeness Score
FIELD.NAME: compl_score
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Completeness score is typically based on either the fraction of markers found as compared to a database or the percent of a genome found as compared to a closely related reference genome. High Quality Draft: >90%, Medium Quality Draft: >50%, and Low Quality Draft: < 50% should have the indicated completeness scores

FIELD.LABEL: Library Reads Sequenced
FIELD.NAME: lib_reads_seq
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: Number of Contigs
FIELD.NAME: number_contig
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of contigs in the cleaned/submitted assembly that makes up a given genome, SAG, MAG, or UViG

FIELD.LABEL: Number of Replicons
FIELD.NAME: num_replicons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: analysis_derived_data
FIELD_GROUP.LABEL: Analysis Derived Data

FIELD.LABEL: Study ID
FIELD.NAME: study_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study

FIELD.LABEL: File Derived From
FIELD.NAME: file_derived_from
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the file that was used to generate the analysis derived data.

FIELD.LABEL: Inferred Cell Type
FIELD.NAME: inferred_cell_type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Post analysis cell type or identity declaration based on expression profile or known gene function identified by the performer.

FIELD.LABEL: Post Analysis Cell Well Quality
FIELD.NAME: post_analysis_cell_well_quality
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Performer defined measure of whether the read output from the cell was included in the sequencing analysis. For example, cells might be excluded if a threshold percentage of reads did not map to the genome or if pre-sequencing quality measures were not passed.

FIELD.LABEL: Other Derived Cell Attributes
FIELD.NAME: other_derived_cell_attributes
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any other cell level measurement or annotation as result of the analysis.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: raw_data_processing
FIELD_GROUP.LABEL: Raw Data Processing

FIELD.LABEL: Study ID
FIELD.NAME: study_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study

FIELD.LABEL: Reference Genome
FIELD.NAME: reference_genome
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate version and include stable link to genome data (or attach genome fasta file).

FIELD.LABEL: Genome Annotation
FIELD.NAME: genome_annotation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate version and include stable link. Also indicate if any modification to the original annotation has been applied (e.g. 3' UTR extension) and include modified annotation file employed in the analysis.

FIELD.LABEL: Annotation Filtering
FIELD.NAME: annotation_filtering
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate which features were filtered (i.e. protein coding, pseudo-genes, TCRs, etc.)
FIELD.EXAMPLE: Filtered to include only protein-coding genes

FIELD.LABEL: Genes vs Exons
FIELD.NAME: genes_vs_exons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Quantification using whole gene intervals or exons.

FIELD.LABEL: Library Structure
FIELD.NAME: library_structure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: seqspec format

FIELD.LABEL: Mapping and Demultiplexing Software
FIELD.NAME: mapping_and_demultiplexing_software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reads/UMI

FIELD.LABEL: Read Mapping Statistics
FIELD.NAME: read_mapping_statistics
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Statistics of the Reads or Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI).

FIELD.LABEL: Sequencing Saturation
FIELD.NAME: sequencing_saturation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Depending on number of cells recovered (not targeted) and technology

FIELD.LABEL: UMIs or Barcode Distribution QC
FIELD.NAME: umis_barcode_distribution_qc
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Show Unique Molecular Identifiers (UMIs) per barcode distribution and threshold applied

FIELD.LABEL: Cell or Non-Cell Filtering Strategy
FIELD.NAME: cell_non_cell_filtering_strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Unique Molecular Identifier (UMI) threshold used to discriminate cells from non-cells. Description of algorithm (if any) and parameters used to determine cells or non-cells.

FIELD.LABEL: Other Quality Filters Applied
FIELD.NAME: other_quality_filters_applied
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cells/nuclei discarded based on % mitochondrial reads, % rRNA reads, etc.

FIELD.LABEL: Ambient RNA QC
FIELD.NAME: ambient_rna_qc
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report % UMIs in background cell barcodes, and algorithm (if any) used to remove ambient RNA
FIELD.EXAMPLE: Ambient RNA removed if >5% UMIs in background barcodes

FIELD.LABEL: Predicted Doublet Rate QC
FIELD.NAME: predicted_doublet_rate_qc
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Depending on number of cells recovered (not targeted) and technology

FIELD.LABEL: Individual Organism SNP Demultiplexing
FIELD.NAME: individual_organism_snp_demultiplexing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If carried out, show SNP partitioning quality (e.g. SNP UMAP embedding or covariance matrix), algorithm used

FIELD.LABEL: Assembly Name
FIELD.NAME: assembly_name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name/version of the assembly provided by the submitter that is used in the genome browsers and in the community

FIELD.LABEL: Extrachromosomal Elements
FIELD.NAME: extrachrom_elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids)

FIELD.LABEL: Assembly Quality
FIELD.NAME: assembly_qual
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The assembly quality category is based on sets of criteria outlined for each assembly quality category.

FIELD.LABEL: Assembly Software
FIELD.NAME: assembly_software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for assembly, including version number and parameters

FIELD.LABEL: Annotation
FIELD.NAME: annot
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool used for annotation, or for cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: Feature Prediction
FIELD.NAME: feat_pred
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used to predict UViGs features such as ORFs, integration site, etc

FIELD.LABEL: Completeness Software
FIELD.NAME: compl_software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tools used for completion estimate, i.e. checkm, anvi'o, busco

FIELD.LABEL: Similarity Search Method
FIELD.NAME: sim_search_meth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool used to compare ORFs with database, along with version and cutoffs used

FIELD.LABEL: Relevant Standard Operating Procedures
FIELD.NAME: sop
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: downstream_processing
FIELD_GROUP.LABEL: Downstream Processing

FIELD.LABEL: Study ID
FIELD.NAME: study_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study

FIELD.LABEL: Clustering Algorithm and Version
FIELD.NAME: clustering_algorithm_and_version
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If compared/integrated with existing datasets

FIELD.LABEL: Clustering Parameters
FIELD.NAME: clustering_parameters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If compared/integrated with existing datasets

FIELD.LABEL: Integration/Batch Correction
FIELD.NAME: integration_batch_correction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If compared/integrated with existing datasets

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: data_availability_checklist
FIELD_GROUP.LABEL: Data Availability Checklist

FIELD.LABEL: Source Code
FIELD.NAME: source_code
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: If any newly developed code/software has been used in the processing and downstream analysis of the dataset.
FIELD.EXAMPLE: Source code is hosted on GitHub and includes custom algorithms for UMI count normalization. The repository can be found at: https://github.com/user/umi-normalization.

FIELD.LABEL: UMI Count Matrix
FIELD.NAME: umi_count_matrix
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Gene x cell matrix with UMI counts for each gene in each cell.
FIELD.EXAMPLE: The UMI count matrix is stored in a CSV file with gene IDs as rows (e.g., ENSG00000139618) and cell barcodes as columns (e.g., Cell_001, Cell_002). The matrix file is available at: https://example.com/umi_count_matrix.csv.

FIELD.LABEL: Ensembl IDs
FIELD.NAME: ensembl_ids
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Gene or transcript names should be listed as Ensembl (or other standardized ID), with gene short names in metadata.

FIELD.LABEL: Functional Gene Annotations
FIELD.NAME: functional_gene_annotations
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Any functional annotation generated/used (gene names, GOs, structural domains, etc.).
FIELD.EXAMPLE: Functional gene annotations, including Gene Ontology (GO) terms, are provided in the metadata. For example, the gene 'ENSG00000139618' (BRCA1) is annotated with the GO term 'GO:0003674' (DNA binding).

FIELD.LABEL: Protein Models
FIELD.NAME: protein_models
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: FASTA file with (or stable link to) the predicted proteins associated to genes in the UMI count matrix and matching IDs.
FIELD.EXAMPLE: The protein sequences for genes are provided in a FASTA file available at: https://example.com/protein_models.fasta, where each protein sequence is linked to the corresponding gene ID.

FIELD.LABEL: Cell Metadata
FIELD.NAME: cell_metadata
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Table mapping cell IDs to cluster/cell type/broad cell type annotations.
FIELD.EXAMPLE: Cell metadata includes information such as cell type annotations ('Tumor', 'Normal') and experimental conditions ('Control', 'Treatment'). This data is available in a table at: https://example.com/cell_metadata.csv.

FIELD.LABEL: Cluster-Level Normalised Expression Tables
FIELD.NAME: cluster_level_normalised_expression_tables
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Expression tables that show normalised gene expression at the cluster or cell-type level.
FIELD.EXAMPLE: Normalised gene expression data at the cluster level is provided in a tab-delimited text file. For example, gene 'ENSG00000139618' (BRCA1) has expression values for clusters: Cluster_1: 1200, Cluster_2: 900. The full expression table is available at: https://example.com/cluster_level_expression.csv.

FIELD.LABEL: Other Resource Files
FIELD.NAME: other_resource_files
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Necessary to re-use and interpret the data. E.g. barcode information in complex, serial multiplexing protocols (clicktags).
FIELD.EXAMPLE: Barcode information used in multiplexing protocols is provided in a separate file, which can be accessed at: https://example.com/barcode_data.csv.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: file
FIELD_GROUP.LABEL: File

FIELD.LABEL: Study ID
FIELD.NAME: study_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this study

FIELD.LABEL: Library Preparation ID
FIELD.NAME: library_prep_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.

FIELD.LABEL: Sequencing ID
FIELD.NAME: sequencing_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.

FIELD.LABEL: File ID
FIELD.NAME: file_id
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique alphanumeric identifier for this file

FIELD.LABEL: Read 1 File
FIELD.NAME: read_1_file
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name or accession of the file that contains read 1.

FIELD.LABEL: Read 2 File
FIELD.NAME: read_2_file
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name or accession of the file that contains read 2.

FIELD.LABEL: Index 1 File
FIELD.NAME: index_1_file
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the file that contains index 1.

FIELD.LABEL: Index 2 File
FIELD.NAME: index_2_file
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name of the file that contains index 2.

FIELD.LABEL: Read 1 Checksum
FIELD.NAME: read_1_file_checksum
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Result of a hash function calculated on the content of the read 1 file to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).

FIELD.LABEL: Read 2 Checksum
FIELD.NAME: read_2_file_checksum
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Result of a hash function calculated on the content of the read 2 file to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).

FIELD.LABEL: Index 1 Checksum
FIELD.NAME: index_1_file_checksum
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Result of a hash function calculated on the content of the index 1 file to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).

FIELD.LABEL: Index 2 Checksum
FIELD.NAME: index_2_file_checksum
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Result of a hash function calculated on the content of the index 2 file to verify file integrity. Commonly used algorithms include MD5 and SHA-1. The checksums should be separated by a comma (,).

FIELD.LABEL: White List Barcode File
FIELD.NAME: white_list_barcode_file
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A file containing the known cell barcodes in the dataset.

FIELD.LABEL: File Name
FIELD.NAME: file_name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A filename or file name is a name used to uniquely identify a data file related to the study.

FIELD.LABEL: File Type
FIELD.NAME: file_type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A file type is a name given to a specific kind of file. Common file types are fastq, gtf, fasta, bam, archive etc.

FIELD.LABEL: Expression Data File
FIELD.NAME: expression_data_file
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The name or accession of the file which quantifies the level of gene, transcript, or protein expression in a given biological sample or condition.
